ref: 13900 svadhāˊ f. ʻ self -- power, pleasure ʼ (ánu svadhāˊm ʻ at will, by nature ʼ) RV., svadhāˊḥ pl. ʻ (sexual) desire (?) ʼ AV. 19. 49. 2.
P. sah f. ʻ desire of cow for bull ʼ;
N. sah ʻ heat (in animals) ʼ; -- connexion with
M. sav f. ʻ taste, relish ʼ is doubtful (LM 415 connects with sápa -- ʻ penis ʼ, but ac. to Molesworth MD s.v. it is a mispronunciation of ċav f. ʻ id. ʼ). --
N. sahajāunu tr. ʻ to like ʼ, intr. ʻ to feel oneself at home ʼ poss. from *saha jānu (cf.
Ku. sā me āuṇo ʻ to be on heat ʼ) whence sahajinu ʻ to be naughty, be spoilt ʼ?
